title.narrative: Guaranteeing livelihoods: producing health, growing lives in the coastal zone of Paraíba

description.narrative: Many poor rural families today are struggling to create a viable livelihood from farming. A number of factors put at risk the continued survival of rural communities, particularly those who have recently secured land title, as well as the very concept of viable agroecological production. To address these issues, through this project the Land Pastoral Commission in Paraiba, Brazil (CPT – Joao Pessoa) aims to improve the quality, quantity and planning of agroecological production as well as commercialisation of farmers participating in the project, through investment in production and strengthening of the Agroecology Network. Combined, these efforts will help to secure access to healthy, nutritious food and improve income for rural communities, ensuring that farming is viable. As a consequence, this project will contribute to enabling the viability of small farming families' livelihoods, avoiding out-migration to urban and peri-urban areas, and therefore reducing rural poverty and preventing poor rural families’ socioeconomic situation from worsening. The project will contribute to reducing poverty, improving livelihoods and quality of life for 60 families from 10 municipalities who currently participate in seven agroecological fairs and one agroecological grocery store in the Archdiocese of Paraíba. Moreover, the project will also reach approximately 5,000 people who buy produce in these spaces. This will be achieved through actions to strengthen the production and commercialisation of agroecological food production, and through the consolidation of the Agroecology Network which the project beneficiaries participate in.
